alert.note: Alert for Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Greene and central Pitt Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Winterville, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Winterville, Ayden, Bell Arthur, House, Bruce, Roundtree, East Carolina University, Pitt Greenville Airport, Dowdy Ficklen Stadium, Simpson, and Falkland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
